audienceSignals: General Public seeking entertainment, education, or information
Content Creators for personal branding, monetization, or community engagement
Businesses and Marketers for advertising, brand awareness, and customer engagement

valueProps.text: Free access to a vast library of videos
Opportunities for community engagement through comments, likes, and shares

proof: Advanced search options including voice search

facts.evidence: YouTube is a video-sharing platform that allows users to upload, share, and view videos.

facts.text: Users can create and upload their own videos.
facts.evidence: Users can create and upload their own videos, fostering a diverse range of content.

facts.text: YouTube has advanced search options including voice search.
facts.evidence: Advanced search options, including voice search, enable users to easily find videos.
The platform uses algorithms to suggest videos based on user preferences and watch history.

facts.text: YouTube Shorts allows for short-form video creation.
facts.evidence: Shorts: A feature for creating and sharing short-form videos, catering to the growing trend of brief content consumption.

facts.text: Users can subscribe to channels for updates.
facts.evidence: Users can subscribe to channels to receive updates and notifications about new content.

facts.text: Watch Later feature allows saving videos for future viewing.
facts.evidence: A feature that allows users to save videos for future viewing.

facts.text: YouTube serves the general public, content creators, and businesses.
facts.evidence: General Public, Content Creators, Businesses and Marketers

facts.text: YouTube offers a freemium model with a premium subscription.
facts.evidence: YouTube operates on a freemium model. While the platform is free to use, it offers a premium subscription service (YouTube Premium).

facts.text: YouTube provides free access to a vast library of videos.
facts.evidence: Free access to a vast library of videos across various genres and topics.

facts.text: YouTube fosters community engagement through interaction features.
facts.evidence: Opportunities for interaction through comments, likes, and shares, fostering a sense of community among users.

facts.text: Content creators can earn revenue through ads and memberships.
facts.evidence: Content creators can earn revenue through ads, memberships, and merchandise shelf features.

facts.text: YouTube's primary revenue stream is advertising.
facts.evidence: The primary revenue stream comes from advertising, where businesses pay to promote their products and services through video ads.
